paper_metadata.title: Evaluating a Financial Inclusion and Livelihood Enhancement Project as a CCT Booster in Honduras

program_information.program_name_citation: Based on a graduation approach, the project provides multi-faceted interventions to randomly selected CCT beneficiaries
program_information.country_citation: In Honduras, the Vice-ministry of Social Integration (Secretaría de Integración Social, SSIS) of the national government initiated a CCT programme
program_information.target_population_citation: Based on a graduation approach, the project provides multi-faceted interventions to randomly selected CCT beneficiaries

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: This approach includes a series of interventions such as consumption assistance (food and/or cash)

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: We estimate intention-to-treat effects and find that the interventions significantly increase financial literacy and inclusion, including knowledge of financial institutions, financial accounts, bookkeeping, and pro-saving attitudes. We also find that the treated individuals in rural areas gain significant income from business, livestock farming, and agriculture by switching employment.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: Based on a graduation approach, the project provides multi-faceted interventions to randomly selected CCT beneficiaries

bonus_information.cost_mentions: Total cost was 58,700 USD (36,700 USD for training, 22,000 USD for assets)
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: The total cost for the implementation of the ACTIVO project was approximately 58,700 USD, which comprised 36,700 USD for classroom training sessions and 22,000 USD for in-kind asset transfers
